greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Fibonacci(n) mod n.
reference: S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science, Wolfram Media, 2002, p. 891.
link: T. D. Noe and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 5000 terms from T. D. Noe)
E. Lucas, Théorie des nombres (annotated scans of a few selected pages)
maple: with(combinat): [ seq( fibonacci(n) mod n, n=1..80) ];
a:= proc(n) local r, M, p; r, M, p:=
do if irem(p, 2, 'p')=1 then r:= r.M mod n fi;
if p=0 then break fi; M:= M.M mod n
program: (MAGMA) [Fibonacci(n) mod n : n in [1..120]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 19 2015
a, b = b, a+b # _Chai Wah Wu_, Nov 26 2015
results.author: John C. Hallyburton, Jr. (hallyb(AT)evms.ENET.dec.com)
